Pivot Limits

Or really, limiting results based on secondary queries.

Let's suppose we wanted to look flight data but only at only the top 5 carriers and only the top 5 destinations.

Carriers by destination produces 1958 rows 

explore flights
| reduce
  carriers.nickname
  destination_code
  flight_count
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Query for the top 5 carriers

Query to find the most interesting carriers.

explore flights
| reduce top 5
  carriers.nickname
  flight_count
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Top 5 Destinstinations 

explore flights
| reduce top 5
  destination_code
  flight_count
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Run all three queries together as Aggregating Subqueries.

Produces a table with a single row and three columns. Each column essentially contains a table

explore flights
| reduce
  main_query is (reduce
    carriers.nickname
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
  top_carriers is (reduce top 5
    carriers.nickname
    flight_count
  )
  top_destinations is (reduce top 5
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Project the main query and use the top nested queries to limit the results

Project produces a cross join of the tables. The filter essentially does an inner join, limiting the main queries results to dimensional values that are produce in the filtering queries.

explore flights
| reduce
  main_query is (reduce
    carriers.nickname
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
  top_carriers is (reduce top 5
    carriers.nickname
    flight_count
  )
  top_destinations is (reduce top 5
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
| project : [
    main_query.nickname = top_carriers.nickname,
    main_query.destination_code = top_destinations.destination_code
  ]
  main_query.*
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Render the results as a pivot table 

explore flights
| reduce
  main_query is (reduce
    carriers.nickname
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
  top_carriers is (reduce top 5
    carriers.nickname
    flight_count
  )
  top_destinations is (reduce top 5
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
| reduce : [
    main_query.nickname = top_carriers.nickname,
    main_query.destination_code = top_destinations.destination_code
  ]
  main_query.nickname
  destination_pivot is (project
    main_query.destination_code
    main_query.flight_count
  )
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights | ^

Filtering applies to all the nested queries.

Reusing this query is pretty simple. In the example below, we filter to California and see the top 5 California Carriers and top 5 Calfornia Destinations.

explore flights : [destination.state:'CA']
| reduce
  main_query is (reduce
    carriers.nickname
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
  top_carriers is (reduce top 5
    carriers.nickname
    flight_count
  )
  top_destinations is (reduce top 5
    destination_code
    flight_count
  )
| reduce : [
    main_query.nickname = top_carriers.nickname,
    main_query.destination_code = top_destinations.destination_code
  ]
  main_query.nickname
  destination_pivot is (project
    main_query.destination_code
    main_query.flight_count
  )
Error: Error: Error(s) compiling model: FILE: internal://internal.malloy line 2: extraneous input 'explore' expecting {, EXPLORE, QUERY, IMPORT, ';'} | explore flights : [destination.state:'CA'] | ^
